lessons.title: Arrays and Lists
lessons.content:
# Arrays and Lists

## Array
- Fixed size
- Same data type
- Contiguous memory

## List
- Dynamic size
- Can store different types
- Flexible

lessons.title: Stacks and Queues
lessons.content:
# Stacks and Queues

## Stack
- LIFO (Last In First Out)
- Operations: Push, Pop, Peek

## Queue
- FIFO (First In First Out)
- Operations: Enqueue, Dequeue

questions.question: Array has:
questions.explanation: Arrays have a fixed size that must be declared.

questions.question: Stack follows:
questions.explanation: Stack follows LIFO (Last In First Out) principle.

questions.question: Queue follows:
questions.explanation: Queue follows FIFO (First In First Out) principle.

questions.question: Adding to stack is called:
questions.explanation: Adding an element to a stack is called Push.

questions.question: Removing from queue is called:
questions.explanation: Removing an element from a queue is called Dequeue.

questions.question: Linked list uses:
questions.explanation: Linked list uses pointers/references to connect nodes.

questions.question: Time complexity to access array element:
questions.explanation: Array access by index is O(1) - constant time.

questions.question: Binary tree node has maximum:
questions.explanation: Binary tree node has at most 2 children.

questions.question: Hash table provides:
questions.explanation: Hash table provides fast (average O(1)) search operations.

questions.question: Graph consists of:
questions.explanation: Graph consists of nodes (vertices) and edges connecting them.
